TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit DataSourceSelectArguments extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides a mechanism that data-bound controls use to request data-related operations from data source controls when data is retrieved. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Data-bound controls use the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments> class to request that a data source control performs additional data-related operations on a result set, such as sorting the data or returning a specific subset of data. These data-related operations are enumerated by the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceCapabilities> enumeration. The following table indicates how the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments> class supports these data-related operations.
|Capability|Related DataSourceSelectArguments properties| |----------------|--------------------------------------------------| |<xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceCapabilities?displayProperty=fullName>|<xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.SortExpression%2A>| |<xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceCapabilities?displayProperty=fullName>|<xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.StartRowIndex%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.MaximumRows%2A>| |<xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceCapabilities?displayProperty=fullName>|<xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.RetrieveTotalRowCount%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.TotalRowCount%2A>|
Data-bound controls explicitly call the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl.PerformSelect%2A> method to bind data, which calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceView.Select%28System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments%2CSystem.Web.UI.DataSourceViewSelectCallback%29> method of the data source control they are associated with. In this way, the data-bound control retrieves data from the data source control on demand. Because the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceView.Select%28System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments%2CSystem.Web.UI.DataSourceViewSelectCallback%29> method accepts a <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments> parameter, the data-bound control is responsible for creating and managing a <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments> object and passing it to the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceView.Select%28System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments%2CSystem.Web.UI.DataSourceViewSelectCallback%29> method when it retrieves data from the data source control.
In some cases, data-bound controls might not need any additional data-related capabilities. In this case, data-bound controls pass an <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.Empty%2A> arguments object to the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceView.Select%28System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments%2CSystem.Web.UI.DataSourceViewSelectCallback%29> method.
For sorted result sets, data-bound controls check a data source view's <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceView.CanSort%2A> property at run time, and add a <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceCapabilities?displayProperty=fullName> capability using the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.AddSupportedCapabilities%28System.Web.UI.DataSourceCapabilities%29> method. As a separate operation, the data-bound control can request a sorted result set from a data source control by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.SortExpression%2A> property on the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments> object passed to the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceView.Select%28System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments%2CSystem.Web.UI.DataSourceViewSelectCallback%29> method.
For paging scenarios, data-bound controls check a data source view's <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceView.CanPage%2A> property at run time, and add a <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceCapabilities?displayProperty=fullName> capability using the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.AddSupportedCapabilities%28System.Web.UI.DataSourceCapabilities%29> method. As a separate operation, the data-bound control can request a subset of data from a data source control for paging by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.StartRowIndex%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.MaximumRows%2A> properties on the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments> object passed to the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceView.Select%28System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments%2CSystem.Web.UI.DataSourceViewSelectCallback%29> method.
To retrieve a total row count for paging scenarios, data-bound controls check a data source view's <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceView.CanRetrieveTotalRowCount%2A> property at run time, and add a <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceCapabilities?displayProperty=fullName> capability using the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.AddSupportedCapabilities%28System.Web.UI.DataSourceCapabilities%29> method. As a separate operation, the data-bound control can request a total row count from a data source control for paging by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.RetrieveTotalRowCount%2A> property on the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments> object passed to the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceView.Select%28System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments%2CSystem.Web.UI.DataSourceViewSelectCallback%29> method. When the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceView.Select%28System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments%2CSystem.Web.UI.DataSourceViewSelectCallback%29> method returns, the total row count is contained by the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.TotalRowCount%2A> property.
> [!IMPORTANT] > If any of the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments> properties are set, but the currently bound data source control does not support the requested capability, an <xref:System.InvalidOperationException> exception is thrown when the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.RaiseUnsupportedCapabilitiesError%28System.Web.UI.DataSourceView%29?displayProperty=fullName> method is called.

Docs.summary: Adds one capability to the instance, which is used to compare supported capabilities and requested capabilities.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Data source controls call the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.AddSupportedCapabilities%28System.Web.UI.DataSourceCapabilities%29> method for each capability the data source supports. After the capabilities are added, any call to the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.RaiseUnsupportedCapabilitiesError%28System.Web.UI.DataSourceView%29> method compares the supported capabilities against the requested capabilities (represented by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.SortExpression%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.RetrieveTotalRowCount%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.MaximumRows%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.StartRowIndex%2A> properties). For example, if a capability such as <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceCapabilities.Sort> is not added but the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.SortExpression%2A> property is set, the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.RaiseUnsupportedCapabilitiesError%28System.Web.UI.DataSourceView%29> method throws a <xref:System.NotSupportedException> exception.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that represents the maximum number of data rows that a data source control returns for a data retrieval operation.
Docs.value: The maximum number of data rows that a data source returns for a data retrieval operation. The default value is 0, which indicates that all possible data rows are returned.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.MaximumRows%2A> property supports paging scenarios. Data-bound controls check a data source view's <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceView.CanPage%2A> property at run time, and add a <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceCapabilities?displayProperty=fullName> capability using the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.AddSupportedCapabilities%28System.Web.UI.DataSourceCapabilities%29> method if the view supports paging. If the data-bound control fails to add the capability, and the paging properties are set on a <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments> object passed to the data source view during a data retrieval operation, an <xref:System.InvalidOperationException> exception might be thrown.
The data-bound control can request a subset of data from a data source control for paging by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.StartRowIndex%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.MaximumRows%2A> properties on the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments> object passed to the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceView.Select%28System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments%2CSystem.Web.UI.DataSourceViewSelectCallback%29> method.
> [!IMPORTANT] > If any of the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments> properties are set, but the currently bound data source control does not support the requested capability, an <xref:System.InvalidOperationException> exception is thrown when the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.RaiseUnsupportedCapabilitiesError%28System.Web.UI.DataSourceView%29?displayProperty=fullName> method is called.

Docs.param: The data source view that performs the data retrieval operation.
Docs.summary: Compares the capabilities requested for an operation against those that the specified data source view supports.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.RaiseUnsupportedCapabilitiesError%28System.Web.UI.DataSourceView%29> method is used by data-bound controls to compare additional requested capabilities represented by the properties of the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments> class, such as the ability to sort or page through a result set, with the capabilities supported by the data source view. The view calls its own <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceView.RaiseUnsupportedCapabilityError%28System.Web.UI.DataSourceCapabilities%29> method for each possible capability defined in the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceCapabilities> enumeration.
> [!IMPORTANT] > If any of the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments> properties are set, but the currently bound data source control does not support the requested capability, an <xref:System.InvalidOperationException> exception is thrown when the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.RaiseUnsupportedCapabilitiesError%28System.Web.UI.DataSourceView%29?displayProperty=fullName> method is called.

Docs.exception: The data source view does not support the data source capability specified.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether a data source control should retrieve a count of all the data rows during a data retrieval operation.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.RetrieveTotalRowCount%2A> property supports paging scenarios. Set this property to `true` to request a total row count from the data source control during the data-retrieval operation. Check the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceView.CanRetrieveTotalRowCount%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property to determine whether a data source view supports retrieving a total row count. If the data source supports it, the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.TotalRowCount%2A> property is set by the data source control during the course of a data retrieval operation and the total data row count is returned in the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.TotalRowCount%2A> property, much as a value is returned in an output parameter of a method.
> [!IMPORTANT] > If any of the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments> properties are set, but the currently bound data source control does not support the requested capability, an <xref:System.InvalidOperationException> exception is thrown when the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.RaiseUnsupportedCapabilitiesError%28System.Web.UI.DataSourceView%29?displayProperty=fullName> method is called.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.SortExpression%2A> property supports sorting scenarios.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that represents the starting position the data source control should use when retrieving data rows during a data retrieval operation.
Docs.value: The starting row position from which a data source control retrieves data. The default value is 0, which indicates that the starting position is the beginning of the result set.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.StartRowIndex%2A> property supports paging scenarios. Data-bound controls check a data source view's <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceView.CanPage%2A> property at run time, and add a <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceCapabilities?displayProperty=fullName> capability using the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.AddSupportedCapabilities%28System.Web.UI.DataSourceCapabilities%29> method if the view supports paging. If the data-bound control fails to add the capability, and the paging properties are set on a <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments> object passed to the data source view during a data retrieval operation, an <xref:System.InvalidOperationException> exception might be thrown.
As a separate operation, the data-bound control can request a subset of data from a data source control by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.StartRowIndex%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.MaximumRows%2A> properties on the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments> object passed to the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceView.Select%28System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments%2CSystem.Web.UI.DataSourceViewSelectCallback%29?displayProperty=fullName> method.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the number of rows retrieved during a data retrieval operation.
Docs.value: The total number of data rows retrieved by the data retrieval operation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.TotalRowCount%2A> property supports paging scenarios. Data source and data source view controls differ in their internal implementation for how to retrieve total row counts. Check the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceView.CanRetrieveTotalRowCount%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property to determine whether a data source view supports retrieving a total row count during a data-retrieval operation. If the data source supports it, the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.TotalRowCount%2A> property is set by the data source control during the course of a data-retrieval operation, and the total data row count is returned in the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.TotalRowCount%2A> property, much as a value is returned in an output parameter of a method.
